committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Energy Research and Development

official_title: To establish a commission to study the research needs of the United States that can be performed by the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory and its conversion to a National Research Facility.

summary.text: National Research Facility Act of 1990 - Establishes the National Commission on Research Needs which shall identify neglected nondefense-related research needs and devise a revised mission for the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, that directs most of that Laboratory's research efforts toward such needs. Directs the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the President and the Congress by January 1, 1992. Terminates the Commission 90 days after it submits such report.

titles.title: To establish a commission to study the research needs of the United States that can be performed by the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory and its conversion to a National Research Facility.
